answerText: The Birds[10] The Birds is a work by this ancient Greek playwright, who depicted the women of Greece attempting to end the Peloponnesian war using a sex strike in his Lysistrata.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 3 | 5 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Iris flies away and reports her mistreatment to Zeus in one section of this play, and one character chases away the geometer Meton in another scene. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this comedy in which Pisthetaerus takes over the city of Cloudcuckooland and blocks the offerings of the people below to the gods.
